intro: Ephemerantha annamensis, commonly known as the Annam ephemeral, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Vietnam. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom briefly during the wet season. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, often growing in shaded, moist habitats.
